NAS - Neural Access System

Modules¶

The Neural Access System modules are divided into two sections, namely gui and src. The gui section contains another folder with the designs of individual graphical user windows. These designs were created using qt designer. The project also contains a db folder for registered users and a db folder also contains a tmp folder for temporarily storing the files needed for the registration itself. The resources folder is used to store non-self-face stimuli and necessary images for the graphical user interface.

Most modules contain preset values for some parameters, which you can edit in the config.py file. For information about the config.py file, visit the configuration chapter.

Main File¶

Graphic User Interface¶

The graphical user interface consists of four windows, namely MainWindow, RegistrationWindow , RegStimulationWindow and LoginStimulationWindow.

MainWindow¶

RegistrationWindow¶

RegStimulationPresentation¶

LoginStimulationPresentation¶

Source¶

Source files consist of user, self_face, stimuli_creator, eeg_recorder , data_processing and classifier.

User¶

class nas.src.user.User(name, surname, login_id)[source]¶

Class for creating a user object and storing it.

Parameters

  • name (string) – User name.

  • surname (string) – User surname.

  • login_id (string) – User login ID.

User’s stimulus getter.

Returns

Picture of a user’s face.

Return type

save_user()[source]¶

Saves the user object using pickle library. The path where the object is saved can be changed in config.py.

set_reg_data(user_stimuli_windows, window_types)[source]¶

Registration data setter. Length of user_stimuli_windows and window_types must be the same.

Parameters

  • user_stimuli_windows (list TODO) – User responses to stimuli divided into time windows.

  • window_types (list TODO) – Types of individual time windows. 1 for self-face and 0 for non-self-face.

set_user_stimulus(stimulus)[source]¶

User’s stimulus setter.

Parameters

stimulus (base64 string) – Picture of a user’s face.

SelfFace¶

class nas.src.self_face.SelfFace(path)[source]¶

A class that creates a stimulus from a photo of a user’s face. Stimulus is an image encoded in base64 string.

Parameters

path (string) – Path to the desired photo. This path can be changed in config.py.

create()[source]¶

It will try to crop the user’s face. Sets the success of the operation. Sets the success of the operation and encodes this result using base64. The processed photo is temporarily saved in tmp_image_path. This path can be changed in config.py.

get_face_b64()[source]¶

Stimulus getter.

Returns

Encoded stimulus.

Return type

base64 string

get_status()[source]¶

Create status getter. This status is used to report an error to the user.

Returns

Status of operation. True if successful otherwise False.

Return type

bool

StimuliCreator¶

class nas.src.stimuli_creator.StimuliCreator(user_face)[source]¶

Class for random display of stimuli to the user. These stimuli consist of self-face and non-self-face images.

Parameters

user_face (base64 string) – User stimulus.

get_stimuli_types()[source]¶

Return types of generated stimuli types. This list is used for classification.

Returns

List of generated stimuli types.

Return type

list

learning_stimuli()[source]¶

Stimulation for the registration process. This stimulation is not randomized. Every fifth stimulus is self-face stimulus.

Returns

set_non_self_face_stimulus() or set_self_face_stimulus()

Return type

QPixmap

randomized_stimuli()[source]¶

Stimulation for the log in process. This stimulation is randomized.

Returns

set_non_self_face_stimulus() or set_self_face_stimulus()

Return type

QPixmap

static set_non_self_face_stimulus()[source]¶

Return type

DataProcessing¶

class nas.src.data_processing.DataProcessing(data, timestamps, stimuli_timestamps, stimuli_num)[source]¶

A class that processes and filters EEG data.

Parameters

  • data (numpy.array) – EEG data.

  • timestamps (numpy.array) – EEG data timestamps.

  • stimuli_timestamps (numpy.array) – Timestamps of stimulation.

  • stimuli_num (int) – Number of stimules.

create_time_windows()[source]¶

Method to get stimuli time windows.

Returns

List of time windows.

Return type

list

filter_data()[source]¶

Filters data from unwanted artifacts and filters noise.

Classifier¶

class nas.src.classifier.Classifier(login_data, reg_data, reg_data_types)[source]¶

A class that classifies login EEG data.

Parameters

  • login_data (list) – Login EEG data. List of login data time windows.

  • reg_data (list) – Registration EEG data. List of registration data time windows.

  • reg_data_types (list) – Registration data time windows types.

classify(classification_method)[source]¶

Classify login EEG data.

Parameters

classification_method (string) – Method of classification.

Returns

Result of classification.

Return type

list

reduce_dimension_lda()[source]¶

Reduction of the dimension of EEG data for the correct functioning of the classification method.
